documentContentReferences.name: Screening Procedures Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from the footnote of Table 1 (Schedule of Activities) to Section 8 for details on procedures specific to screening sites in the US.

documentContentReferences.name: COVID-19 Vaccine Risk Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 2.3.1.1 to Section 10.5 for potential risks and mitigation measures due to COVID-19 vaccine.

documentContentReferences.name: Dose Modification for Risk Mitigation
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Table 3 (Potential Risks and Mitigation Strategy) to Section 6.6 for dose modification or discontinuation procedures.

documentContentReferences.name: Adaptive Design Features
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 4.1 to Table 4 for a description of adaptive features and their limits.

documentContentReferences.name: Dose Modification Criteria
documentContentReferences.sectionTitle: ALXN1840 Dose Modifications for Individual Participants
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Table 4 to Table 7 for criteria on when a dose should be decreased or interrupted.

documentContentReferences.name: Blood Donation Exclusion Criteria
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 5.3 (Lifestyle Considerations) to Section 5.2 regarding exclusion criteria for blood donation.

documentContentReferences.name: Contraceptive Methods
documentContentReferences.sectionTitle: Contraceptive Guidance and Collection of Pregnancy Information
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 5.3 to Section 10.4 for a description of appropriate contraceptive methods.

documentContentReferences.name: Contraceptive Start Times
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 5.3 to Section 5.1 for start times for contraceptive use.

documentContentReferences.name: Discontinuation Data Collection
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 7.1 to the Schedule of Activities (SoA, Section 1.3) for data to be collected at the time of study intervention discontinuation.

documentContentReferences.name: Discontinuation for Liver Function
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 7.1 to Dose Modification criteria (Section 6.6) for discontinuing intervention due to abnormal liver function.

documentContentReferences.name: Discontinuation for Pregnancy
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 7.1 to Section 8.2.6 regarding discontinuation from study intervention due to pregnancy.

documentContentReferences.name: QTc Withdrawal Criteria
documentContentReferences.sectionTitle: Discontinuation of Study Intervention and Participant Discontinuation/Withdrawal
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 8.2.3 to Section 7 for QTc withdrawal criteria.

documentContentReferences.name: Clinical Laboratory Tests List
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 8.2.4 to Section 10.2 for the list of clinical laboratory tests to be performed.

documentContentReferences.name: AE/SAE Procedures
documentContentReferences.sectionTitle: Adverse Events: Definitions and Procedures for Recording, Evaluating, Follow-up, and Reporting
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 8.3 to Section 10.3 for procedures on recording, evaluating, follow-up, and reporting AEs and SAEs.

documentContentReferences.name: Lost to Follow-up Definition
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 8.3.3 to Section 7.3 for the definition of lost to follow-up.

documentContentReferences.name: Genetic Testing Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 8.3.6 to Section 8.7 clarifying that biobanked samples will not be used for genetic testing.

documentContentReferences.name: Molybdenum Measurement Details
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 8.5 to Section 8.1.1 for details of molybdenum measured in food, drinks, urine, and feces.

documentContentReferences.name: Biomarker Details
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 8.8 to Section 8.6 for details of total copper and PUF-copper, ceruloplasmin, and other biomarkers.

documentContentReferences.name: Analysis Populations
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 9.3 to Table 8, which defines the population sets used for analysis.

documentContentReferences.name: Schedule of Activities Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Multiple references throughout the document (e.g., Sections 7.1, 8.2.3, 8.5, 8.6, 9.4.3) point to the Schedule of Activities (Table 1) for the timing and frequency of study assessments.

commentAnnotations.text: Abbreviations: ALT = alanine aminotransferase; AST = aspartate aminotransferase; IB = Investigatorâ€™s Brochure; PK = pharmacokinetics; WD = Wilson disease.
commentAnnotations.sourceSection: Table 3: Potential Risks and Mitigation Strategy

commentAnnotations.text: Reference to the Investigator's Brochure (IB) for data on risks such as transaminase elevations, anemia, and leukopenia.
Abbreviations: CRF = case report form; CRU = clinical research unit; EOS = End of Study; SoA = Schedule of Activities.
Abbreviations: ICF = informed consent form; PD = pharmacodynamic; PK = pharmacokinetic.

Note: total molybdenum and PUF molybdenum concentration-time profiles on Day 28 after the last 15 mg ALXN1840 dose will be extrapolated to Day 29 (0-24 hr) and subtracted from the observed Day 29 concentration-time profiles after the first 30 mg
